ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned lots of key business vocabulary and new sentence structures to maintain formality.
I learned essential words, phrases, and cultural knowledge about the Chinese entrepreneurial landscape and its connection to the world economy.

A lot of vocab and language skills to discuss business and the economy. Conversational chinese and knowledge of some current affairs. A lot of practice with essay writing and presentations, which I think improved my fluency
Chinese language but specific to business field

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The small class size meant we were able to all get individualized attention and the opportunity to speak. 

I think that the class could be improved by offering more points per quiz or having more guideline for preparing for quizzes.

Professor Chen has tremendous passion about the course material and answered all questions patiently to ensure understanding. She always provided helpful feedback in a timely manner. The course was engaging and informative.

Strengths:
- lots of opportunities to talk, and read real world sources to improve comprehension and speaking

Weaknesses:
- I would say the minitalk sections went a bit long, and it would be better if more of those classes were devoted to the teacher talking, and discussing things together
This course tried to do a bit too much given the fact that it was a seminar that met twice a week

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would to anyone who wants to be in business or in economics and wants to hone their Chinese skills.

I would recommend this course to students who are interested in learning about entrepreneurship in China and China's connection with the global economy. Even if a student lacks some foundation knowledge, Professor Chen offers ample office hours for students to gain understanding.
Yes, I think it has a good structure to improve your Chinese
Yes if you're specifically interested in learning business related language and do not mind a higher workload
